intro: Lagascea, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have small, simple leaves and produce clusters of tiny, four-petaled flowers. The fruits are dry pods that release seeds when mature. Lagascea species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils.
